hdr164406-socioEconomicSustainability.def: Net national savings plus education expenditure and minus energy depletion, mineral depletion, net forest depletion, and carbon dioxide and particulate emissions damage. Net national savings are equal to gross national savings less the value of consumption of fixed capital.
hdr164406-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Adjusted net savings
hdr164406-socioEconomicSustainability.source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.
hdr164406-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr170006-socioEconomicSustainability.def: A measure of the degree of product concentration in exports from a country (also referred to as the Herfindahl-Hirschmann Index). A value closer to 0 indicates that a countryâ€™s exports are more homogeneously distributed among a series of products (reflecting a well diversified economy); a value closer to 1 indicates that a countryâ€™s exports are highly concentrated among a few products.
hdr170006-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Concentration index
hdr170006-socioEconomicSustainability.source: UNCTAD (United Nations Conference on Trade and Development) (2020). Data Center. http://unctadstat.unctad.org. Accessed11 September 2020.
hdr170006-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: UNCTAD (United Nations Conference on Trade and Development) (2020). Data Center. http://unctadstat.unctad.org. Accessed11 September 2020.

hdr174206-socioEconomicSustainability.def: Sum of principal repayments and interest actually paid in currency, goods or services on long-term debt; interest paid on short-term debt; and repayments (repurchases and charges) to the International Monetary Fund. It is expressed as a percentage of exports of goods, services and primary income.
hdr174206-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Total debt service
hdr174206-socioEconomicSustainability.source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.
hdr174206-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.
hdr174206-socioEconomicSustainability.units: % of exports of goods, services and primary income

hdr178306-socioEconomicSustainability.def: Outlays on additions to the fixed assets of the economy plus net changes in inventories. Fixed assets include land improvements (such as fences, ditches and drains); plant, machinery and equipment purchases; and construction of roads, railways and the like, including schools, offices, hospitals, private residential dwellings and commercial and industrial buildings. Inventories are stocks of goods held by firms to meet temporary or unexpected fluctuations in production or sales as well as goods that are work in progress. Net acquisitions of valuables are also considered capital formation. Gross capital formation was formerly known as gross domestic investment.
hdr178306-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Gross capital formation
hdr178306-socioEconomicSustainability.source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.
hdr178306-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr179406-socioEconomicSustainability.def: Percentage of the labour force ages 15 and older with intermediate or advanced education, as classified by the International Standard Classification of Education.
hdr179406-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Skilled labour force
hdr179406-socioEconomicSustainability.source: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.
hdr179406-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: ILO (2020). ILOSTAT database. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr179706-socioEconomicSustainability.def: Sum of government expenditure on education and health divided by military expenditure.
hdr179706-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Ratio of education and health expenditure to military expenditure
hdr179706-socioEconomicSustainability.source: HDRO calculations based on data from World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed on 22 July 2020.
hdr179706-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: HDRO calculations based on data from World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed on 22 July 2020.

hdr181706-socioEconomicSustainability.def: People living in rural areas with access to electricity, expressed as a percentage of the total rural population. It includes electricity sold commercially (both on grid and off grid) and self-generated electricity but excludes unauthorized connections.
hdr181706-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Rural population with access to electricity
hdr181706-socioEconomicSustainability.source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.
hdr181706-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.

hdr182806-socioEconomicSustainability.def: Percentage of the population drinking water from an improved source that is accessible on premises, available when needed and free from faecal and priority chemical contamination. Improved water sources include piped water, boreholes or tubewells, protected dug wells, protected springs, and packaged or delivered water
hdr182806-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Population using safely managed drinking-water services
hdr182806-socioEconomicSustainability.source: WHO (World Health Organization) (2020). Global Health Observatory. www.who.int/gho/. Accessed 21 July 2020.
hdr182806-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: WHO (World Health Organization) (2020). Global Health Observatory. www.who.int/gho/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr183206-socioEconomicSustainability.def: Annual compound change rate of the overall loss in Human Development Index (HDI) value due to inequality over 2010â€“2019.
hdr183206-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Overall loss in HDI value due to inequality
hdr183206-socioEconomicSustainability.source: HDRO calculations based on the Inequality-adjusted HDI time series.
hdr183206-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: HDRO calculations based on the Inequality-adjusted HDI time series.

hdr186806-socioEconomicSustainability.def: Annual compound change rate of the income share of the poorest 40 percent of the population over 2005â€“2018.
hdr186806-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Average annual change in the share of bottom 40 percent
hdr186806-socioEconomicSustainability.source: HDRO calculations based on data from World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed on 22 July 2020.
hdr186806-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: HDRO calculations based on data from World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed on 22 July 2020.

hdr195206-socioEconomicSustainability.def: Percentage of the population using an improved sanitation facility that is not shared with other households and where excreta are safely disposed of in situ or treated off site. Improved sanitation facilities include flush/pour flush toilets connected to piped sewer systems, septic tanks or pit latrines; pit latrines with slabs (including ventilated pit latrines, and composting toilets.
hdr195206-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Population using safely managed sanitation services
hdr195206-socioEconomicSustainability.source: WHO (World Health Organization) (2020). Global Health Observatory. www.who.int/gho/. Accessed 21 July 2020.
hdr195206-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: WHO (World Health Organization) (2020). Global Health Observatory. www.who.int/gho/. Accessed 21 July 2020.

hdr52306-socioEconomicSustainability.def: Current and capital expenditures (both public and private) on creative work undertaken systematically to increase knowledge, including knowledge of humanity, culture and society, and the use of knowledge for new applications. Research and development covers basic research, applied research and experimental development.
hdr52306-socioEconomicSustainability.name: Research and development expenditure
hdr52306-socioEconomicSustainability.source: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.
hdr52306-socioEconomicSustainability.dataset: World Bank (2020a). World Development Indicators database. Washington, DC. http://data.worldbank.org. Accessed 22 July 2020.
